Frontex unlawfully shared thousands of people's personal data with European police
description: In the name of combating migrant smugglers, the European Union's border surveillance agency spent years collecting information on migrants and civil society activists deemed 'suspect,' before passing it on to Europol, the EU police cooperation agency.

Texas flash flood: Camp Mystic says at least 27 campers and counselors died
description: With more rain on the way, the risk of life-threatening flooding is still high in Texas on Monday, as crews search urgently for the missing following the deluge that killed more than 80 people. Officials say the death toll is sure to rise.

headline: Macron heads to UK for first official visit of King Charles III's reign
description: French President Emmanuel Macron and his wife Brigitte are to arrive at Windsor Castle on Tuesday for the first state visit of the reign of King Charles III. Macron will also address UK MPs during a three-day visit expected to improve a Franco-British relationship strained by Brexit.

headline: 'French women have been free to open bank accounts for 60 years, but they still struggle to achieve financial independence'
description: Women in France have had the right to open a bank account without their husband's permission for 60 years, since July 13, 1965. But the financial independence so desired by French women, according to a July 7 study, has yet to be achieved, explains Le Monde's Isabelle Chaperon in her column.

headline: The Oder Bridge between Germany and Poland: The decline of a European symbol
description: After Berlin reinstated border checks to block migrants at the bridge in Frankfurt an der Oder, Warsaw responded with similar measures, disrupting daily life for locals. Once emblematic of the European Union's eastward expansion, the site now bears witness to the rise of xenophobic sentiment.

Putin's choice of a long war in Ukraine
description: The suspension of American aid to Kyiv fits neatly into the Russian leader's military plans: to intensify his offensive in Ukraine this summer, and to sustain an endless conflict, now synonymous with the survival of his regime through a newfound 'stability' built on a war economy.

headline: In Bosnia and Herzegovina, stone treasures, canyons and cypress trees await
description: The Balkan country, with its painful past, is rich in historical sites and mountainous landscapes − from the Kravica Waterfalls to the Olympic sites of Sarajevo, from a medieval fortress to Tito's bunker.

headline: The relentless rush to build dams in China's Tiger Leaping Gorge: 'If we lose our land, we lose everything'
description: 'The Himalayas Overheating' (5/6). In the far southwest of China, plans to build massive reservoirs as part of hydroelectric dam projects have condemned dozens of mountain villages to disappear.
